com.mschwartz.dateslider

Class DateSlider

  • java.lang.Object
    • DialogFragment
      • com.mschwartz.dateslider.DateSlider

  • public class DateSlider
extends DialogFragment
    A Dialog subclass that hosts a SliderContainer and a couple of buttons, displays the current time in the header, and notifies an observer when the user selects a time.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes

      Defines the interface which defines the methods of the OnDateSetListener

      • setMinuteInterval

        protected DateSlider setMinuteInterval(int minuteInterval)
        Sets the interval for the "minute" part of the timeslider. Allowed range is from 1 to 120 whereas only certain values are reasonable. Consider the following values: 1,2,5,10,15,30,60,120
        Parameters:
        minuteInterval - The minute interval used for the slider
        Returns:
        DateSlider

      • setInitialTime

        protected DateSlider setInitialTime(long initialTime)
        Sets the time in utc timezone.
        Parameters:
        initialTime -
        Returns:

      • setHours

        protected DateSlider setHours(int startHour,
                              int endHour)
        Sets the start- and end hours in locale-specific timezone. This can be used if the calendar should only accept working hours. Make sure that either both are set to -1 or both are set to a value from 0 to 23 whereas starthours must be before endHours. Note that endHours only specify the "hour" part of the calender but does not restrict the minutes. In other words setting the endHour to 17 allows times up to 17:59 (5:59pm). When setting the minuteInterval to values larger than 60 take care to set the start and endHours accordingly. For example when setting minuteInterval to 120, the startHour should be dividable by 2 (8, 10, 12) whereas the endHour should be an odd number (13, 15, 17)
        Parameters:
        startHour -
        endHour -
        Returns:
